treatment.description: Annuals, biennials, or perennials; eglandular. Trichomes [simple or] absent. Cauline leaves sessile; blade base usually auriculate, sometimes amplexicaul, margins usually entire. Racemes ebracteate, elongated or not in fruit. Flowers actinomorphic; sepals erect or ascending [spreading], lateral pair not saccate basally; petals white, pink, or purple, claw present, often obscure; filaments unappendaged, not winged; pollen 3-colpate.
